description.zh-cn: 北宋著名政治家、文学家、思想家、改革家，唐宋八大家之一。在宋神宗支持下推行熙宁变法，其思想被称为“荆公新学”。
description.en: A famous politician, writer, thinker, and reformer of the Northern Song dynasty, and one of the Eight Great Prose Masters of the Tang and Song. He implemented the Xining Reforms with the support of Emperor Shenzong, and his thought is known as the 'Jinggong New Learning'.

description.zh-cn: 北宋第六位皇帝，支持王安石推行熙宁变法。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Northern Song dynasty, who supported Wang Anshi in implementing the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 由王安石在宋神宗支持下发动的一场旨在富国强兵的社会经济改革运动，引发了新旧党争。
description.en: A socio-economic reform movement aimed at enriching the state and strengthening the military, launched by Wang Anshi with the support of Emperor Shenzong, which triggered the New-Old Party Disputes.

description.zh-cn: 北宋政治家、史学家，旧党领袖，熙宁变法的主要反对者。
description.en: A politician and historian of the Northern Song dynasty, leader of the conservative faction, and a major opponent of the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 北宋政治家、文学家，唐宋八大家之一，曾多次举荐王安石。
description.en: A politician and writer of the Northern Song dynasty, one of the Eight Great Prose Masters of the Tang and Song, who recommended Wang Anshi on multiple occasions.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相，王安石在扬州任职时的上司，后反对青苗法。
description.en: A chancellor of the Northern Song dynasty, Wang Anshi's superior during his tenure in Yangzhou, and later an opponent of the Green Sprouts Law.

description.zh-cn: 北宋散文家，“三苏”之一，认为王安石“不近人情”，并作《辨奸论》攻击他。
description.en: A prose writer of the Northern Song dynasty, one of the 'Three Sus', who considered Wang Anshi 'inhumane' and attacked him in his essay 'Discerning the Traitorous'.

description.zh-cn: 一篇托名苏洵的政论文章，旨在攻击王安石的为人与品行。
description.en: A political essay attributed to Su Xun, aimed at attacking Wang Anshi's personality and character.

description.zh-cn: 新党核心人物，王安石变法的重要助手，后与王安石决裂。
description.en: A key figure in the reformist faction and an important assistant to Wang Anshi during the reforms, who later broke with Wang.

description.zh-cn: 北宋第四位皇帝，王安石于其在位期间步入仕途，并向其上《万言书》陈述改革思想。
description.en: The fourth emperor of the Northern Song dynasty, during whose reign Wang Anshi began his official career and submitted the 'Ten Thousand Word Memorial' outlining his reformist ideas.

description.zh-cn: 宋代宰相的正式官称之一。
description.en: One of the official titles for the chancellor in the Song dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 宋代副宰相的官称。
description.en: The official title for the vice-chancellor in the Song dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 王安石之父，官至都官员外郎。
description.en: Father of Wang Anshi, who served as an Assistant Gentleman of the Bureau of State Ceremonial.

description.zh-cn: 王安石的母亲，抚州金溪人，王益的续弦。
description.en: Mother of Wang Anshi, from Jinxi, Fuzhou, and the second wife of Wang Yi.

description.zh-cn: 王安石长子，文学家，临川三王之一。其早逝对王安石打击甚大。
description.en: The eldest son of Wang Anshi, a writer and one of the 'Three Wangs of Linchuan'. His premature death was a great blow to Wang Anshi.

description.zh-cn: 王安石的妻子。
description.en: The wife of Wang Anshi.

description.zh-cn: 王安石的女婿及学生，新党成员。
description.en: Son-in-law and student of Wang Anshi, a member of the reformist faction.

description.zh-cn: 熙宁变法中的一项核心财经政策，由政府在青黄不接时向农民提供贷款，秋后收取本息。
description.en: A key financial policy of the Xining Reforms, where the government provided loans to farmers during the lean season, to be repaid with interest after the autumn harvest.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相，在新旧党争中支持王安石，并曾请求神宗复用王安石为相。
description.en: A chancellor of the Northern Song dynasty who supported Wang Anshi during the New-Old Party Disputes and once requested Emperor Shenzong to reappoint Wang Anshi as chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 北宋御史中丞，上疏弹劾王安石“奸诈十事”，是变法初期的主要反对者之一。
description.en: Censor-in-chief of the Northern Song dynasty who impeached Wang Anshi on 'ten counts of treachery', one of the main opponents in the early stages of the reforms.

description.zh-cn: 因熙宁变法引发的，以王安石为首的新党与以司马光为首的旧党之间长期的政治斗争。
description.en: The long-term political struggle between the reformist faction led by Wang Anshi and the conservative faction led by Sima Guang, triggered by the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 北宋将领，提出“平戎三策”，并在王安石支持下主持熙河开边，收复河湟地区。
description.en: A general of the Northern Song dynasty who proposed the 'Three Strategies for Pacifying the Barbarians' and, with Wang Anshi's support, led the Xihe campaign to recapture the Hehuang region.

description.zh-cn: 北宋在王安石、王韶推动下对西夏发动的一系列军事行动，旨在收复河湟地区，扭转对西夏的战略劣势。
description.en: A series of military campaigns launched by the Northern Song against the Western Xia, promoted by Wang Anshi and Wang Shao, aimed at recapturing the Hehuang region and reversing the strategic disadvantage against Western Xia.

description.zh-cn: 王安石于嘉祐三年（1058年）向宋仁宗呈上的奏疏，系统地阐述了他的改革思想，被视为熙宁变法的理论大纲。
description.en: A memorial submitted by Wang Anshi to Emperor Renzong in 1058, systematically expounding his reformist ideas, considered the theoretical outline of the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 王安石是王益之子。
description.en: Wang Anshi is the son of Wang Yi.

description.zh-cn: 王安石是吴氏之子。
description.en: Wang Anshi is the son of Wu Shi.

description.zh-cn: 王雱是王安石的长子。
description.en: Wang Pang is the eldest son of Wang Anshi.

description.zh-cn: 王安石与吴氏于康定元年（1040年）成婚。
description.en: Wang Anshi married Wu Shi in 1040.

description.zh-cn: 蔡卞在治平年间王安石居于江宁时，成为其学生。
description.en: Cai Bian became Wang Anshi's student when Wang was living in Jiangning during the Zhiping era.

description.zh-cn: 蔡卞娶王安石次女为妻，是王安石的女婿。
description.en: Cai Bian married Wang Anshi's second daughter, becoming his son-in-law.

description.zh-cn: 欧阳修赏识王安石的才华，并多次向朝廷举荐他。
description.en: Ouyang Xiu appreciated Wang Anshi's talent and recommended him to the court on multiple occasions.

description.zh-cn: 王安石在宋神宗朝担任宰相等职，是其臣子。
description.en: Wang Anshi served as chancellor and other positions during the reign of Emperor Shenzong, and was his subject.

description.zh-cn: 宋神宗支持并任命王安石主持熙宁变法。
description.en: Emperor Shenzong supported and appointed Wang Anshi to lead the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 王安石是熙宁变法的主要设计者和推行者。
description.en: Wang Anshi was the main designer and implementer of the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 熙宁变法的推行引发了朝廷内部新旧两派的激烈冲突。
description.en: The implementation of the Xining Reforms triggered intense conflicts between the new and old factions within the court.

description.zh-cn: 韩琦上疏反对王安石推行的青苗法，两人政见不合。
description.en: Han Qi submitted a memorial opposing the Green Sprouts Law implemented by Wang Anshi, and the two had political disagreements.

description.zh-cn: 熙宁三年二月，韩琦上奏反对青苗法的实施，认为其违背了“抑兼并、济困乏”的初衷。
description.en: In the second month of the third year of Xining (1070), Han Qi submitted a memorial opposing the implementation of the Green Sprouts Law, arguing that it contradicted the original intention of 'suppressing annexation and aiding the needy'.

description.zh-cn: 司马光是王安石变法的主要政治对手，领导旧党反对新法。
description.en: Sima Guang was Wang Anshi's main political rival, leading the conservative faction to oppose the new policies.

description.zh-cn: 司马光作为旧党领袖，坚决反对王安石推行的新法。
description.en: As the leader of the conservative faction, Sima Guang firmly opposed the new policies implemented by Wang Anshi.

description.zh-cn: 苏洵认为王安石“不近人情”，并在王安石母丧时作《辨奸论》攻击他。
description.en: Su Xun considered Wang Anshi 'inhumane' and attacked him by writing 'Discerning the Traitorous' during the mourning period for Wang's mother.

description.zh-cn: 《辨奸论》将王安石比作王衍、卢杞等历史上的奸臣，旨在攻击其品行，阻碍其政治前途。
description.en: The 'Discerning the Traitorous' compared Wang Anshi to treacherous ministers in history such as Wang Yan and Lu Qi, aiming to attack his character and obstruct his political career.

description.zh-cn: 吕惠卿原是王安石的得力助手，后因权力之争与王安石决裂，成为政敌。
description.en: Lu Huiqing was originally Wang Anshi's capable assistant, but later broke with him over power struggles and became a political enemy.

position.en: Joint Manager of Affairs with the Secretariat-Chancellery

description.zh-cn: 王安石两次被任命为宰相。
description.en: Wang Anshi was appointed chancellor twice.

description.zh-cn: 熙宁二年二月，王安石被任命为参知政事，开始推行变法。
description.en: In the second month of the second year of Xining (1069), Wang Anshi was appointed Associate Manager of Affairs and began to implement the reforms.

description.zh-cn: 王安石撰写并向宋仁宗上呈《上仁宗皇帝言事书》（即《万言书》）。
description.en: Wang Anshi wrote and submitted the 'Memorial to Emperor Renzong on Current Affairs' (also known as the 'Ten Thousand Word Memorial').

description.zh-cn: 王安石的《万言书》系统地阐述了他的改革思想，被认为是熙宁变法的理论大纲。
description.en: Wang Anshi's 'Ten Thousand Word Memorial' systematically expounded his reformist ideas and is considered the theoretical outline of the Xining Reforms.

description.zh-cn: 王安石在宋仁宗朝考中进士并开始其仕途。
description.en: Wang Anshi passed the imperial examination and began his official career during the reign of Emperor Renzong.

description.zh-cn: 王安石支持王韶收复河湟的计划，并帮助其获得朝廷任命，推动熙河开边。
description.en: Wang Anshi supported Wang Shao's plan to recapture the Hehuang region and helped him obtain a court appointment, promoting the Xihe campaign.

description.zh-cn: 王韶向神宗上《平戎三策》，是熙河开边的主要提议者和执行者。
description.en: Wang Shao submitted the 'Three Strategies for Pacifying the Barbarians' to Emperor Shenzong, and was the main proposer and executor of the Xihe campaign.

description.zh-cn: 作为宰相，王安石是熙河开边政策的重要支持者和推动者。
description.en: As chancellor, Wang Anshi was a key supporter and promoter of the Xihe campaign policy.

description.zh-cn: 在王安石任参知政事四个月后，时任御史中丞的吕诲上疏弹劾王安石“奸诈十事”。
description.en: Four months after Wang Anshi's appointment as Associate Manager of Affairs, Censor-in-chief Lü Hui submitted a memorial impeaching Wang Anshi on 'ten counts of treachery'.

description.zh-cn: 在宋神宗打算重用王安石时，时任御史中丞的唐介认为王安石“难大任”，若为政必多所更变。
description.en: When Emperor Shenzong intended to appoint Wang Anshi to a high position, Censor-in-chief Tang Jie argued that Wang was 'unfit for great responsibility' and would cause many changes if in power.
